body.p:
Newport January 16th 1861
To
His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Dear Sir.

There was some feeling the other day in our town on the occasion of firing guns for Major Anderson which met with hearty disapproval of Many persons especially of the Breckinridge men which came very near resulting in a serious difficulty. My brother James T. Berry who is a minute man at Memphis happened to be in town on the occasion and his wearing a Blue Cockade seemed to excite some persons very much who have been constantly abusing him & calling him ^a^ traitor, and by the advice of his friends he carried a ^small^ pistol which some of the dirty submissionists in this benighted abolition c of my native state felt was a great outrage against law & order he had not drown ^it^ upon any one nor has he Ever been before a legel tribunal in this State for any offence before=is the reason I ask the interposition of executive clemency, The fine was ^15$^ inflicted before E W Hawkins, Mayor of the city on the 16th day of Jany 1861.

Most Respectfully your friend
A. S. Berry

Newprt City Ct
$15.
Jas T. Berry
Respite 6 Mos
B. M
Issd Jany 18. 1861
